revised_title: Heterogenetic Modes of Origin of Flagellated Monads, Fungus-Germs, and Ciliated Infusoria
tldr: The author investigates the formation of flagellated monads, fungus-germs, and ciliated infusoria from the "proligerous pellicle" that forms on organic infusions. They describe various processes, including heterogenetic biocrasis, and the role of temperature in the development of these organisms. The study provides insight into the complex interactions and transformations of microorganisms in their natural environment.
